intro: Fuirena welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitschia mirabilis, is a unique plant native to the Namib Desert in Namibia. It is a gymnosperm with two large, leathery leaves that can grow up to 3 meters in length. The plant has a thick, woody stem that stores water, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers and is adapted to extreme environmental conditions. Fuirena welwitschii is considered a living fossil, with a lineage dating back over 100 million years.
